title: What is the percentage of profit if a shopkeeper sells 2 lemons at the cost price of 5 lemons? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the Cost price of 1 lemon = Re. 1.00 Then Cost price of 5 lemons = Rs. 5.00 Then Selling Price of 2 lemons = Rs. 5.00 - Equation 1 The Cost Price of 2 lemons = Rs. 2.00 - Equation 2 From Equation 2 and Equation 1 Profit = Rs. (5.00 - 2.00) = Rs. 3.00 Profit% = (Profit/CP) * 100 = (3/2) * 100 = 1.5 * 100 =150% : Final Answer
